key_risks: Regulatory and legal challenges including significant penalties for overcharging clients and hidden markups on FX transactions
Cybersecurity risks due to data breaches and the high-profile nature of custodial services
Market and operational risks from global market volatility and interest rate fluctuations
Competitive pressures from global custodians, asset managers, and fintech disruptors
controversies: $115 million criminal penalty for defrauding clients by overcharging expenses
$88 million settlement with the SEC for overcharging investment-firm clients
$382 million settlement for hidden markups on foreign exchange transactions
social_issues: Expansion of ESG investment products to meet client demand for sustainable investing
governance_issues: Systemic issues in pricing transparency and compliance
Recent executive appointments focusing on technology and ESG to strengthen leadership

sources.title: District of Massachusetts | State Street Corporation to Pay $115 ...
sources.snippet: BOSTON - Massachusetts-based global financial services company State Street Corporation entered into a deferred prosecution agreement and agreed to pay a $115 million criminal penalty to resolve charges that it engaged in a scheme to defraud a number of the bank's clients by secretly overcharging for expenses related to the bank's custody of client assets.
